intro: Gongora truncata var. alba, commonly known as the white-lip orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking white petals and a distinctive white lip, which are often adorned with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, relying on aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air. Its flowers bloom in clusters, producing a fragrant aroma that attracts pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts for its beauty and unique appearance.
